availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Horatio Fleming Simrall (Jefferson County, KY, attorney and law professor, offered VP of prov govt)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and law professor. Shelby County, Kentucky, native. Son of James Simrall and Rebecca Graham Simrall. Attended Hanover College in Hanover, Indiana, and Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Married Lydia Ann Newell Simrall in Mississippi on February 22, 1842. Father of Graham H. Simrall, James Simrall, Horatio F. Simrall, Joseph Simrall, and George B. N. Simrall. Served in the Mississippi state legislature from 1846 to 1848. Attorney in Wilkinson County, Mississippi, in 1850. Law professor at the University of Louisville from 1857 to 1861. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860. Attorney in Louisville in 1861. Offered vice-presidency of the Kentucky provisional government under George Johnson in 1861.

ab.bibl:
